name: Kubernetes
hint: Select the environment where you want to deploy Logz.io Telemetry Collector.

datasources.name: Kubernetes
datasources.description: Logz.io uses OpenTelemetry instrumentation with FluenD and Helm charts to deploy and monitor Kubernetes architecture.
datasources.hint: Select the type of data you'd like to ship: logs, metrics, and traces.

params.name: isTaint
params.label: Taints and Tolerations
params.description: Taints allow a node to repel a series of pods. Tolerations are applied to pods and allow them to schedule onto nodes with matching taints. Enable to force deployment on all pods.
params.hint: By checking this option the Logz.io Telemetry Collector will be deployed on all nodes.

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect logs from your Kubernetes cluster components and applications pods
Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect metrics from your Kubernetes cluster, nodes and pods
Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect traces from your instrumented applications in the Kubernetes environment
